p:
Infection by ZIKV progresses as a self-limiting disease like observed in dengue infection, with mild clinical manifestations such as fever, macular or papular rash, arthritis and arthralgia, nonpurulent conjunctivitis, myalgia, headache, edema, orbital pain and vomiting
6, 7 . However, during Zika epidemics in French Polynesia (2013) and Brazil (2015), greater numbers of cases of Guillain-Barré and congenital syndrome (microcephaly) were observed
7– 9 . Strong evidence suggests a link between ZIKV infection and microcephaly once the viral genome has been detected in the amniotic fluid and brains of affected fetuses
5, 9 .
